title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that several spells of showers will occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts.

title: 2025 LG Election: Sri Lankans vote to elect local councilors
byline: The 2025 Local Government (LG) election is scheduled to be held today where over 17 million Sri Lankans are eligible to vote to elect members for 339 Local Government institutions.

title: Voting for 2025 Local Govt. Election begins
byline: The 2025 Local Government Elections officially commenced at 7:00 a.m. today (06), marking a significant milestone in the country’s democratic process following a seven-year hiatus.

title: Russia says all airports in Moscow shut after drone attack
byline: Russia says Ukraine has launched an overnight drone attack targeting Moscow for the second night in a row.

title: Sri Lanka Decides: Ada Derana special live broadcast of LG election results
byline: Ada Derana’s special election broadcast – ‘Sri Lanka Decides’ – is fully geared to bring viewers the latest updates and results from the 2025 Local Government Elections today (May 6).

title: ‘Voters without polling cards still eligible to vote’ – Commission General
byline: The Commissioner General of Elections, Saman Sri Ratnayake, has confirmed that there is no obstacle for any eligible voter to cast their ballot in today’s 2025 Local Government Elections, even if they have not received their official polling card.

title: 2025 LG Election: Voter turnout as at 9am
byline: The district-level voter turnout for the 2025 Local Government (LG) election has already exceeded 10 percent in several districts, according to reports.

title: Person injured in police shooting at Katunayake
byline: A person has reportedly been injured and hospitalised following a shooting carried out by police officers in the 18th Mile Post area in Katunayake.

title: 2025 LG Election: Voter turnout as at 10am
byline: The district-level voter turnout for the 2025 Local Government (LG) election has already exceeded 20 percent in several districts, according to reports.

title: Two more students arrested over Sabaragamuwa Uni. ragging incident
byline: Another two third-year students from the Faculty of Technology at the Sabaragamuwa University have been arrested by officers of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with an ongoing investigation into the alleged ragging incident involving a second-year student.

title: OpenAI scraps plans to transform into for-profit company
byline: ChatGPT inventor OpenAI has reversed course on plans to transform into a for-profit company, announcing on Monday that it will remain under the control of its original non-profit entity.

title: 2025 LG Election: Over 30% voter turnout as at 12 noon
byline: The district-level voter turnout for the 2025 Local Government (LG) election has already exceeded 30 percent in most of the districts, according to reports.

title: 2025 LG Election: Voter turnout as at 1pm
byline: The district-level voter turnout for the 2025 Local Government (LG) election has already exceeded 40 percent in several districts, according to reports.

title: Shah Rukh Khan makes historic Met Gala debut
byline: Shah Rukh Khan, the Bollywood superstar known as SRK, made a historic debut at the 2025 Met Gala, becoming the first male actor from India to grace the prestigious event.

title: India slams auction of jewels linked to Buddha, calls for their return
byline: India’s government has slammed the proposed sale of a dazzling cache of jewels linked to the remains of the Buddha and called for their return to India, where they were dug up more than a century ago by a British colonial official.

title: 2025 LG Election: Voter turnout as at 2pm
byline: The district-level voter turnout for the 2025 Local Government (LG) election has already exceeded 45 percent in several districts, according to reports.

title: Six more Uni. students remanded over ragging incident
byline: Six more students of Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka, who were arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with the death of a fellow student allegedly due to ragging, have been remanded until May 16 by the Balangoda Magistrate’s Court.

title: UK visa applications for some nations, including Sri Lanka, could be restricted: Report
byline: Visa applications from nationalities thought most likely to overstay and claim asylum in the UK could be restricted under a new government crackdown.

title: 2025 LG Election: Voter turnout as at 3pm
byline: The district-level voter turnout for the 2025 Local Government (LG) election has already exceeded 45 percent in several districts, according to reports.

title: Polls close for Sri Lanka’s Local Govt Elections
byline: Voting in Sri Lanka’s first Local Government Elections in nearly seven years officially closed on Tuesday (May 06) with a somewhat subdued voter turnout.

title: World Bank president to visit Sri Lanka tomorrow
byline: World Bank Group President Ajay Banga will visit Sri Lanka on Wednesday (May 7), the first presidential visit to the country by a World Bank Group president in nearly 20 years.

title: 2025 LG Election: Voter turnout after polls close
byline: The district-level voter turnout for the 2025 Local Government (LG) election has exceeded 60 percent in several districts after polls closed on Tuesday, according to reports.

title: Germany’s Merz fails to be elected chancellor in unprecedented debacle
byline: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz failed to secure enough parliamentary votes to become chancellor on Tuesday, throwing politics in Europe’s largest economy into disarray as it seeks to emerge from recession and stem far-right extremism.

title: Ada Derana’s special live broadcast of election results
byline: Ada Derana’s special live broadcast of the results of the 2025 Local Government Elections – ‘Sri Lanka Decides| Election Night’ – kicked off a short while ago.

title: First results of 2025 LG Election released; NPP claims Tangalle UC
byline: The first results of the 2025 Local Government (LG) Election have been released by the Election Commission of Sri Lanka.

title: Independent Group wins Haputale UC
byline: The Independent Group 1 has won the Haputale Urban Council of the Badulla District.

title: NPP secures Hambantota MC
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Hambantota Municipal Council of the Hambantota District.

title: NPP secures Ambalangoda UC
byline: The National People’s Power has won the Ambalangoda Urban Council of the Galle District.
